title: Content Management Database (CMDB)
description: A configuration management database (CMDB) is an ITIL term for a database used by an organization to store information about hardware and software assets (commonly referred to as configuration items).
key-ideas: CMDB is used to manage asset inventory (HW and SW) and the relationships between them.
CMDB can assist in identifying and managing critical assets within the organization.
CMDB can be used to identify baseline and expected system states and configurations within the organization.
CMDB can be used for change management.
Items in the CMDB are called Configuration Items (CI).
